document.masterDocTitle: A key to the Mexican genera of Tanymecini (Coleoptera: Curculionidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pandeleteius
is the most diverse New World genus of tanymecines, with almost 200 species ranging from southern Canada to southern Chile and Argentina ( Howden 2011 ) of which 38 species are recorded from Mexico . The relationships among
Pandeleteius ( Pandeleteius )
,
Pandeleteius ( Exmenetypus )
and
Airosimus
need to be evaluated. To separate Mexican species, see Champion (1911) and Howden (1959 , 1986 , 1998 ). The biology of some of these species is available in Howden (1959 , 1970 , 1993a , 1996).

Pandeleteius championi
Howden, 1974
. New country record: “ MEXICO : Q. Roo ,
32km N Felipe Carrillo Puerto
,
30m
,
17.VII.1983
, M. Kaulbars ” ( 1 specimen , CMNC);
“ MEXICO : Oaxaca , Monte Albán ,
19.IX.1989
, E. Barrera ” ( 1 specimen , CNIN )
;
“ MEXICO : Jalisco , 13km ESE Tuxcacuesco ,
900m
, 19°40’6” N 104°1’53” W ,
13.X.2001
, fogging 1, McKamey et al” ( 6 specimens , CMNC )
.
